revised_title: A New Calorimeter for Determining Radiating Powers of Surfaces in Air
tldr: The author designed a new calorimeter to measure the radiating powers of surfaces in air and applied it to various mineral substances. The calorimeter allowed for the determination of the absolute amount of heat emanating from a surface under given conditions, providing a more accurate measurement than previous methods. This new instrument was simpler and more versatile, making it applicable to a wider range of surfaces and allowing for greater accuracy in determining the radiating powers of different materials.
